    6027            0 :       if ( tga_inverted )
    6028              :       {
    6029            0 :          for (j = 0; j*2 < tga_height; ++j)
    6030              :          {
    6031            0 :             int index1 = j * tga_width * tga_comp;
    6032            0 :             int index2 = (tga_height - 1 - j) * tga_width * tga_comp;
    6033            0 :             for (i = tga_width * tga_comp; i > 0; --i)
    6034              :             {
    6035            0 :                unsigned char temp = tga_data[index1];
    6036            0 :                tga_data[index1] = tga_data[index2];
    6037            0 :                tga_data[index2] = temp;
    6038            0 :                ++index1;
    6039            0 :                ++index2;
    6040              :             }
    6041              :          }
    6042              :       }
    6043              :       //   clear my palette, if I had one
    6044            0 :       if ( tga_palette != NULL )
    6045              :       {
    6046            0 :          STBI_FREE( tga_palette );
    6047              :       }
    6048              :    }
    6049              : 
    6050              :    // swap RGB - if the source data was RGB16, it already is in the right order
    6051            0 :    if (tga_comp >= 3 && !tga_rgb16)
    6052              :    {
    6053            0 :       unsigned char* tga_pixel = tga_data;
    6054            0 :       for (i=0; i < tga_width * tga_height; ++i)
    6055              :       {
    6056            0 :          unsigned char temp = tga_pixel[0];
    6057            0 :          tga_pixel[0] = tga_pixel[2];
    6058            0 :          tga_pixel[2] = temp;
    6059            0 :          tga_pixel += tga_comp;
    6060              :       }
    6061              :    }
    6062              : 
    6063              :    // convert to target component count
    6064            0 :    if (req_comp && req_comp != tga_comp)
    6065            0 :       tga_data = stbi__convert_format(tga_data, tga_comp, req_comp, tga_width, tga_height);
    6066              : 
    6067              :    //   the things I do to get rid of an error message, and yet keep
    6068              :    //   Microsoft's C compilers happy... [8^(
    6069            0 :    tga_palette_start = tga_palette_len = tga_palette_bits =
    6070            0 :          tga_x_origin = tga_y_origin = 0;
    6071              :    STBI_NOTUSED(tga_palette_start);
    6072              :    //   OK, done
    6073            0 :    return tga_data;
    6074              : }
    6075              : #endif
    6076              : 
    6077              : // *************************************************************************************************
    6078              : // Photoshop PSD loader -- PD by Thatcher Ulrich, integration by Nicolas Schulz, tweaked by STB
    6079              : 
    6080              : #ifndef STBI_NO_PSD
    6081            1 : static int stbi__psd_test(stbi__context *s)
    6082              : {
    6083            1 :    int r = (stbi__get32be(s) == 0x38425053);
    6084            1 :    stbi__rewind(s);
    6085            1 :    return r;
    6086              : }
    6087              : 
    6088            0 : static int stbi__psd_decode_rle(stbi__context *s, stbi_uc *p, int pixelCount)
    6089              : {
    6090              :    int count, nleft, len;
    6091              : 
    6092            0 :    count = 0;
    6093            0 :    while ((nleft = pixelCount - count) > 0) {
    6094            0 :       len = stbi__get8(s);
    6095            0 :       if (len == 128) {
    6096              :          // No-op.
    6097            0 :       } else if (len < 128) {
    6098              :          // Copy next len+1 bytes literally.
    6099            0 :          len++;
    6100            0 :          if (len > nleft) return 0; // corrupt data
    6101            0 :          count += len;
    6102            0 :          while (len) {
    6103            0 :             *p = stbi__get8(s);
    6104            0 :             p += 4;
    6105            0 :             len--;
    6106              :          }
    6107            0 :       } else if (len > 128) {
    6108              :          stbi_uc   val;
    6109              :          // Next -len+1 bytes in the dest are replicated from next source byte.
    6110              :          // (Interpret len as a negative 8-bit int.)
    6111            0 :          len = 257 - len;
    6112            0 :          if (len > nleft) return 0; // corrupt data
    6113            0 :          val = stbi__get8(s);
    6114            0 :          count += len;
    6115            0 :          while (len) {
    6116            0 :             *p = val;
    6117            0 :             p += 4;
    6118            0 :             len--;
    6119              :          }
    6120              :       }
    6121              :    }
    6122              : 
    6123            0 :    return 1;
    6124              : }
    6125              : 
    6126            0 : static void *stbi__psd_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri, int bpc)
    6127              : {
    6128              :    int pixelCount;
    6129              :    int channelCount, compression;
    6130              :    int channel, i;
    6131              :    int bitdepth;
    6132              :    int w,h;
    6133              :    stbi_uc *out;
    6134              :    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
    6135              : 
    6136              :    // Check identifier
    6137            0 :    if (stbi__get32be(s) != 0x38425053)   // "8BPS"
    6138            0 :       return stbi__errpuc("not PSD", "Corrupt PSD image");
    6139              : 
    6140              :    // Check file type version.
    6141            0 :    if (stbi__get16be(s) != 1)
    6142            0 :       return stbi__errpuc("wrong version", "Unsupported version of PSD image");
    6143              : 
    6144              :    // Skip 6 reserved bytes.
    6145            0 :    stbi__skip(s, 6 );
    6146              : 
    6147              :    // Read the number of channels (R, G, B, A, etc).
    6148            0 :    channelCount = stbi__get16be(s);
    6149            0 :    if (channelCount < 0 || channelCount > 16)
    6150            0 :       return stbi__errpuc("wrong channel count", "Unsupported number of channels in PSD image");
    6151              : 
    6152              :    // Read the rows and columns of the image.
    6153            0 :    h = stbi__get32be(s);
    6154            0 :    w = stbi__get32be(s);
    6155              : 
    6156            0 :    if (h > STBI_MAX_DIMENSIONS) return stbi__errpuc("too large","Very large image (corrupt?)");
    6157            0 :    if (w > STBI_MAX_DIMENSIONS) return stbi__errpuc("too large","Very large image (corrupt?)");
    6158              : 
    6159              :    // Make sure the depth is 8 bits.
    6160            0 :    bitdepth = stbi__get16be(s);
    6161            0 :    if (bitdepth != 8 && bitdepth != 16)
    6162            0 :       return stbi__errpuc("unsupported bit depth", "PSD bit depth is not 8 or 16 bit");
    6163              : 
    6164              :    // Make sure the color mode is RGB.
    6165              :    // Valid options are:
    6166              :    //   0: Bitmap
    6167              :    //   1: Grayscale
    6168              :    //   2: Indexed color
    6169              :    //   3: RGB color
    6170              :    //   4: CMYK color
    6171              :    //   7: Multichannel
    6172              :    //   8: Duotone
    6173              :    //   9: Lab color
    6174            0 :    if (stbi__get16be(s) != 3)
    6175            0 :       return stbi__errpuc("wrong color format", "PSD is not in RGB color format");
    6176              : 
    6177              :    // Skip the Mode Data.  (It's the palette for indexed color; other info for other modes.)
    6178            0 :    stbi__skip(s,stbi__get32be(s) );
    6179              : 
    6180              :    // Skip the image resources.  (resolution, pen tool paths, etc)
    6181            0 :    stbi__skip(s, stbi__get32be(s) );
    6182              : 
    6183              :    // Skip the reserved data.
    6184            0 :    stbi__skip(s, stbi__get32be(s) );
    6185              : 
    6186              :    // Find out if the data is compressed.
    6187              :    // Known values:
    6188              :    //   0: no compression
    6189              :    //   1: RLE compressed
    6190            0 :    compression = stbi__get16be(s);
    6191            0 :    if (compression > 1)
    6192            0 :       return stbi__errpuc("bad compression", "PSD has an unknown compression format");
    6193              : 
    6194              :    // Check size
    6195            0 :    if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(4, w, h, 0))
    6196            0 :       return stbi__errpuc("too large", "Corrupt PSD");
    6197              : 
    6198              :    // Create the destination image.
    6199              : 
    6200            0 :    if (!compression && bitdepth == 16 && bpc == 16) {
    6201            0 :       out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(8, w, h, 0);
    6202            0 :       ri->bits_per_channel = 16;
    6203              :    } else
    6204            0 :       out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc(4 * w*h);
    6205              : 
    6206            0 :    if (!out) return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
    6207            0 :    pixelCount = w*h;
    6208              : 
    6209              :    // Initialize the data to zero.
    6210              :    //memset( out, 0, pixelCount * 4 );
    6211              : 
    6212              :    // Finally, the image data.
    6213            0 :    if (compression) {
    6214              :       // RLE as used by .PSD and .TIFF
    6215              :       // Loop until you get the number of unpacked bytes you are expecting:
    6216              :       //     Read the next source byte into n.
    6217              :       //     If n is between 0 and 127 inclusive, copy the next n+1 bytes literally.
    6218              :       //     Else if n is between -127 and -1 inclusive, copy the next byte -n+1 times.
    6219              :       //     Else if n is 128, noop.
    6220              :       // Endloop
    6221              : 
    6222              :       // The RLE-compressed data is preceded by a 2-byte data count for each row in the data,
    6223              :       // which we're going to just skip.
    6224            0 :       stbi__skip(s, h * channelCount * 2 );
    6225              : 
    6226              :       // Read the RLE data by channel.
    6227            0 :       for (channel = 0; channel < 4; channel++) {
    6228              :          stbi_uc *p;
    6229              : 
    6230            0 :          p = out+channel;
    6231            0 :          if (channel >= channelCount) {
    6232              :             // Fill this channel with default data.
    6233            0 :             for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, p += 4)
    6234            0 :                *p = (channel == 3 ? 255 : 0);
    6235              :          } else {
    6236              :             // Read the RLE data.
    6237            0 :             if (!stbi__psd_decode_rle(s, p, pixelCount)) {
    6238            0 :                STBI_FREE(out);
    6239            0 :                return stbi__errpuc("corrupt", "bad RLE data");
    6240              :             }
    6241              :          }
    6242              :       }
    6243              : 
    6244              :    } else {
    6245              :       // We're at the raw image data.  It's each channel in order (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha, ...)
    6246              :       // where each channel consists of an 8-bit (or 16-bit) value for each pixel in the image.
    6247              : 
    6248              :       // Read the data by channel.
    6249            0 :       for (channel = 0; channel < 4; channel++) {
    6250            0 :          if (channel >= channelCount) {
    6251              :             // Fill this channel with default data.
    6252            0 :             if (bitdepth == 16 && bpc == 16) {
    6253            0 :                stbi__uint16 *q = ((stbi__uint16 *) out) + channel;
    6254            0 :                stbi__uint16 val = channel == 3 ? 65535 : 0;
    6255            0 :                for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, q += 4)
    6256            0 :                   *q = val;
    6257            0 :             } else {
    6258            0 :                stbi_uc *p = out+channel;
    6259            0 :                stbi_uc val = channel == 3 ? 255 : 0;
    6260            0 :                for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, p += 4)
    6261            0 :                   *p = val;
    6262              :             }
    6263              :          } else {
    6264            0 :             if (ri->bits_per_channel == 16) {    // output bpc
    6265            0 :                stbi__uint16 *q = ((stbi__uint16 *) out) + channel;
    6266            0 :                for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, q += 4)
    6267            0 :                   *q = (stbi__uint16) stbi__get16be(s);
    6268              :             } else {
    6269            0 :                stbi_uc *p = out+channel;
    6270            0 :                if (bitdepth == 16) {  // input bpc
    6271            0 :                   for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, p += 4)
    6272            0 :                      *p = (stbi_uc) (stbi__get16be(s) >> 8);
    6273              :                } else {
    6274            0 :                   for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, p += 4)
    6275            0 :                      *p = stbi__get8(s);
    6276              :                }
    6277              :             }
    6278              :          }
    6279              :       }
    6280              :    }
    6281              : 
    6282              :    // remove weird white matte from PSD
    6283            0 :    if (channelCount >= 4) {
    6284            0 :       if (ri->bits_per_channel == 16) {
    6285            0 :          for (i=0; i < w*h; ++i) {
    6286            0 :             stbi__uint16 *pixel = (stbi__uint16 *) out + 4*i;
    6287            0 :             if (pixel[3] != 0 && pixel[3] != 65535) {
    6288            0 :                float a = pixel[3] / 65535.0f;
    6289            0 :                float ra = 1.0f / a;
    6290            0 :                float inv_a = 65535.0f * (1 - ra);
    6291            0 :                pixel[0] = (stbi__uint16) (pixel[0]*ra + inv_a);
    6292            0 :                pixel[1] = (stbi__uint16) (pixel[1]*ra + inv_a);
    6293            0 :                pixel[2] = (stbi__uint16) (pixel[2]*ra + inv_a);
    6294              :             }
    6295              :          }
    6296              :       } else {
    6297            0 :          for (i=0; i < w*h; ++i) {
    6298            0 :             unsigned char *pixel = out + 4*i;
    6299            0 :             if (pixel[3] != 0 && pixel[3] != 255) {
    6300            0 :                float a = pixel[3] / 255.0f;
    6301            0 :                float ra = 1.0f / a;
    6302            0 :                float inv_a = 255.0f * (1 - ra);
    6303            0 :                pixel[0] = (unsigned char) (pixel[0]*ra + inv_a);
    6304            0 :                pixel[1] = (unsigned char) (pixel[1]*ra + inv_a);
    6305            0 :                pixel[2] = (unsigned char) (pixel[2]*ra + inv_a);
    6306              :             }
    6307              :          }
    6308              :       }
    6309              :    }
    6310              : 
    6311              :    // convert to desired output format
    6312            0 :    if (req_comp && req_comp != 4) {
    6313            0 :       if (ri->bits_per_channel == 16)
    6314            0 :          out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__convert_format16((stbi__uint16 *) out, 4, req_comp, w, h);
    6315              :       else
    6316            0 :          out = stbi__convert_format(out, 4, req_comp, w, h);
    6317            0 :       if (out == NULL) return out; // stbi__convert_format frees input on failure
    6318              :    }
    6319              : 
    6320            0 :    if (comp) *comp = 4;
    6321            0 :    *y = h;
    6322            0 :    *x = w;
    6323              : 
    6324            0 :    return out;
    6325              : }

    6328              : // *************************************************************************************************
    6329              : // Softimage PIC loader

    6335              : #ifndef STBI_NO_PIC
    6336            1 : static int stbi__pic_is4(stbi__context *s,const char *str)

    6338              :    int i;
    6339            1 :    for (i=0; i<4; ++i)
    6340            1 :       if (stbi__get8(s) != (stbi_uc)str[i])
    6341            1 :          return 0;
    6342              : 
    6343            0 :    return 1;
    6344              : }
    6345              : 
    6346            1 : static int stbi__pic_test_core(stbi__context *s)
    6347              : {
    6348              :    int i;
    6349              : 
    6350            1 :    if (!stbi__pic_is4(s,"\x53\x80\xF6\x34"))
    6351            1 :       return 0;
    6352              : 
    6353            0 :    for(i=0;i<84;++i)

    6357            0 :       return 0;
    6358              :

    6362              : typedef struct
    6363              : {
    6364              :    stbi_uc size,type,channel;
    6365              : } stbi__pic_packet;
    6366              : 
    6367            0 : static stbi_uc *stbi__readval(stbi__context *s, int channel, stbi_uc *dest)
    6368              : {
    6369            0 :    int mask=0x80, i;
    6370              : 
    6371            0 :    for (i=0; i<4; ++i, mask>>=1) {
    6372            0 :       if (channel & mask) {
    6373            0 :          if (stbi__at_eof(s)) return stbi__errpuc("bad file","PIC file too short");
    6374            0 :          dest[i]=stbi__get8(s);
    6375              :       }
    6376              :    }
    6377              : 
    6378            0 :    return dest;
    6379              : }
    6380              : 
    6381            0 : static void stbi__copyval(int channel,stbi_uc *dest,const stbi_uc *src)
    6382              : {
    6383            0 :    int mask=0x80,i;
    6384              : 
    6385            0 :    for (i=0;i<4; ++i, mask>>=1)
    6386            0 :       if (channel&mask)
    6387            0 :          dest[i]=src[i];
    6388            0 : }
    6389              : 
    6390            0 : static stbi_uc *stbi__pic_load_core(stbi__context *s,int width,int height,int *comp, stbi_uc *result)
    6391              : {
    6392            0 :    int act_comp=0,num_packets=0,y,chained;
    6393              :    stbi__pic_packet packets[10];
    6394              : 
    6395              :    // this will (should...) cater for even some bizarre stuff like having data
    6396              :     // for the same channel in multiple packets.
    6397              :    do {
    6398              :       stbi__pic_packet *packet;
    6399              : 
    6400            0 :       if (num_packets==sizeof(packets)/sizeof(packets[0]))
    6401            0 :          return stbi__errpuc("bad format","too many packets");
    6402              : 
    6403            0 :       packet = &packets[num_packets++];
    6404              : 
    6405            0 :       chained = stbi__get8(s);
    6406            0 :       packet->size    = stbi__get8(s);
    6407            0 :       packet->type    = stbi__get8(s);
    6408            0 :       packet->channel = stbi__get8(s);
    6409              : 
    6410            0 :       act_comp |= packet->channel;
    6411              : 
    6412            0 :       if (stbi__at_eof(s))          return stbi__errpuc("bad file","file too short (reading packets)");
    6413            0 :       if (packet->size != 8)  return stbi__errpuc("bad format","packet isn't 8bpp");
    6414            0 :    } while (chained);
    6415              : 
    6416            0 :    *comp = (act_comp & 0x10 ? 4 : 3); // has alpha channel?
    6417              : 
    6418            0 :    for(y=0; y<height; ++y) {
    6419              :       int packet_idx;
    6420              : 
    6421            0 :       for(packet_idx=0; packet_idx < num_packets; ++packet_idx) {
    6422            0 :          stbi__pic_packet *packet = &packets[packet_idx];
    6423            0 :          stbi_uc *dest = result+y*width*4;
    6424              : 
    6425            0 :          switch (packet->type) {
    6426            0 :             default:
    6427            0 :                return stbi__errpuc("bad format","packet has bad compression type");
    6428              : 
    6429            0 :             case 0: {//uncompressed
    6430              :                int x;
    6431              : 
    6432            0 :                for(x=0;x<width;++x, dest+=4)
    6433            0 :                   if (!stbi__readval(s,packet->channel,dest))
    6434            0 :                      return 0;
    6435            0 :                break;
    6436              :             }
    6437              : 
    6438            0 :             case 1://Pure RLE
    6439              :                {
    6440            0 :                   int left=width, i;
    6441              : 
    6442            0 :                   while (left>0) {
    6443              :                      stbi_uc count,value[4];
    6444              : 
    6445            0 :                      count=stbi__get8(s);
    6446            0 :                      if (stbi__at_eof(s))   return stbi__errpuc("bad file","file too short (pure read count)");
    6447              : 
    6448            0 :                      if (count > left)
    6449            0 :                         count = (stbi_uc) left;
    6450              : 
    6451            0 :                      if (!stbi__readval(s,packet->channel,value))  return 0;
    6452              : 
    6453            0 :                      for(i=0; i<count; ++i,dest+=4)
    6454            0 :                         stbi__copyval(packet->channel,dest,value);
    6455            0 :                      left -= count;
    6456              :                   }
    6457              :                }
    6458            0 :                break;
    6459              : 
    6460            0 :             case 2: {//Mixed RLE
    6461            0 :                int left=width;
    6462            0 :                while (left>0) {
    6463            0 :                   int count = stbi__get8(s), i;
    6464            0 :                   if (stbi__at_eof(s))  return stbi__errpuc("bad file","file too short (mixed read count)");
    6465              : 
    6466            0 :                   if (count >= 128) { // Repeated
    6467              :                      stbi_uc value[4];
    6468              : 
    6469            0 :                      if (count==128)
    6470            0 :                         count = stbi__get16be(s);
    6471              :                      else
    6472            0 :                         count -= 127;
    6473            0 :                      if (count > left)
    6474            0 :                         return stbi__errpuc("bad file","scanline overrun");
    6475              : 
    6476            0 :                      if (!stbi__readval(s,packet->channel,value))
    6477            0 :                         return 0;
    6478              : 
    6479            0 :                      for(i=0;i<count;++i, dest += 4)
    6480            0 :                         stbi__copyval(packet->channel,dest,value);
    6481              :                   } else { // Raw
    6482            0 :                      ++count;
    6483            0 :                      if (count>left) return stbi__errpuc("bad file","scanline overrun");
    6484              : 
    6485            0 :                      for(i=0;i<count;++i, dest+=4)
    6486            0 :                         if (!stbi__readval(s,packet->channel,dest))
    6487            0 :                            return 0;
    6488              :                   }
    6489            0 :                   left-=count;
    6490              :                }
    6491            0 :                break;
    6492              :             }
    6493              :          }
    6494              :       }
    6495              :    }
    6496              : 
    6497            0 :    return result;
    6498              : }
    6499              : 
    6500            0 : static void *stbi__pic_load(stbi__context *s,int *px,int *py,int *comp,int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
    6501              : {
    6502              :    stbi_uc *result;
    6503              :    int i, x,y, internal_comp;
    6504              :    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
    6505              : 
    6506            0 :    if (!comp) comp = &internal_comp;
    6507              : 
    6508            0 :    for (i=0; i<92; ++i)
    6509            0 :       stbi__get8(s);
    6510              : 
    6511            0 :    x = stbi__get16be(s);
    6512            0 :    y = stbi__get16be(s);
    6513              :

    6550              : // GIF loader -- public domain by Jean-Marc Lienher -- simplified/shrunk by stb

    6552              : #ifndef STBI_NO_GIF
    6553              : typedef struct
    6554              : {

    6557              :    stbi_uc suffix;

    6608            0 : static int stbi__gif_header(stbi__context *s, stbi__gif *g, int *comp, int is_info)

    6654            0 : static void stbi__out_gif_code(stbi__gif *g, stbi__uint16 code)
    6655              : {
    6656              :    stbi_uc *p, *c;
    6657              :    int idx;
    6658              : 
    6659              :    // recurse to decode the prefixes, since the linked-list is backwards,
    6660              :    // and working backwards through an interleaved image would be nasty
    6661            0 :    if (g->codes[code].prefix >= 0)
    6662            0 :       stbi__out_gif_code(g, g->codes[code].prefix);
    6663              : 
    6664            0 :    if (g->cur_y >= g->max_y) return;
    6665              : 
    6666            0 :    idx = g->cur_x + g->cur_y;
    6667            0 :    p = &g->out[idx];
    6668            0 :    g->history[idx / 4] = 1;
    6669              : 
    6670            0 :    c = &g->color_table[g->codes[code].suffix * 4];
    6671            0 :    if (c[3] > 128) { // don't render transparent pixels;
    6672            0 :       p[0] = c[2];
    6673            0 :       p[1] = c[1];
    6674            0 :       p[2] = c[0];
    6675            0 :       p[3] = c[3];
    6676              :    }
    6677            0 :    g->cur_x += 4;
    6678              : 
    6679            0 :    if (g->cur_x >= g->max_x) {
    6680            0 :       g->cur_x = g->start_x;

    6682              :

    6689              : }
    6690              : 
    6691            0 : static stbi_uc *stbi__process_gif_raster(stbi__context *s, stbi__gif *g)
    6692              : {
    6693              :    stbi_uc lzw_cs;
    6694              :    stbi__int32 len, init_code;
    6695              :    stbi__uint32 first;
    6696              :    stbi__int32 codesize, codemask, avail, oldcode, bits, valid_bits, clear;
    6697              :    stbi__gif_lzw *p;
    6698              : 
    6699            0 :    lzw_cs = stbi__get8(s);
    6700            0 :    if (lzw_cs > 12) return NULL;
    6701            0 :    clear = 1 << lzw_cs;
    6702            0 :    first = 1;
    6703            0 :    codesize = lzw_cs + 1;
    6704            0 :    codemask = (1 << codesize) - 1;
    6705            0 :    bits = 0;
    6706            0 :    valid_bits = 0;
    6707            0 :    for (init_code = 0; init_code < clear; init_code++) {
    6708            0 :       g->codes[init_code].prefix = -1;
    6709            0 :       g->codes[init_code].first = (stbi_uc) init_code;
    6710            0 :       g->codes[init_code].suffix = (stbi_uc) init_code;
    6711              :    }
    6712              : 
    6713              :    // support no starting clear code
    6714            0 :    avail = clear+2;
    6715            0 :    oldcode = -1;
    6716              : 
    6717            0 :    len = 0;
    6718              :    for(;;) {
    6719            0 :       if (valid_bits < codesize) {
    6720            0 :          if (len == 0) {
    6721            0 :             len = stbi__get8(s); // start new block
    6722            0 :             if (len == 0)
    6723            0 :                return g->out;
    6724              :          }
    6725            0 :          --len;
    6726            0 :          bits |= (stbi__int32) stbi__get8(s) << valid_bits;
    6727            0 :          valid_bits += 8;
    6728              :       } else {
    6729            0 :          stbi__int32 code = bits & codemask;
    6730            0 :          bits >>= codesize;
    6731            0 :          valid_bits -= codesize;
    6732              :          // @OPTIMIZE: is there some way we can accelerate the non-clear path?
    6733            0 :          if (code == clear) {  // clear code
    6734            0 :             codesize = lzw_cs + 1;
    6735            0 :             codemask = (1 << codesize) - 1;
    6736            0 :             avail = clear + 2;
    6737            0 :             oldcode = -1;
    6738            0 :             first = 0;
    6739            0 :          } else if (code == clear + 1) { // end of stream code
    6740            0 :             stbi__skip(s, len);
    6741            0 :             while ((len = stbi__get8(s)) > 0)
    6742            0 :                stbi__skip(s,len);
    6743            0 :             return g->out;
    6744            0 :          } else if (code <= avail) {
    6745            0 :             if (first) {
    6746            0 :                return stbi__errpuc("no clear code", "Corrupt GIF");
    6747              :             }
    6748              : 
    6749            0 :             if (oldcode >= 0) {
    6750            0 :                p = &g->codes[avail++];
    6751            0 :                if (avail > 8192) {
    6752            0 :                   return stbi__errpuc("too many codes", "Corrupt GIF");
    6753              :                }
    6754              : 
    6755            0 :                p->prefix = (stbi__int16) oldcode;
    6756            0 :                p->first = g->codes[oldcode].first;
    6757            0 :                p->suffix = (code == avail) ? p->first : g->codes[code].first;
    6758            0 :             } else if (code == avail)
    6759            0 :                return stbi__errpuc("illegal code in raster", "Corrupt GIF");
    6760              : 
    6761            0 :             stbi__out_gif_code(g, (stbi__uint16) code);
    6762              : 
    6763            0 :             if ((avail & codemask) == 0 && avail <= 0x0FFF) {
    6764            0 :                codesize++;
    6765            0 :                codemask = (1 << codesize) - 1;
    6766              :             }
    6767              : 
    6768            0 :             oldcode = code;
    6769              :          } else {
    6770            0 :             return stbi__errpuc("illegal code in raster", "Corrupt GIF");
    6771              :          }
    6772              :       }
    6773            0 :    }
    6774              : }
    6775              : 
    6776              : // this function is designed to support animated gifs, although stb_image doesn't support it
    6777              : // two back is the image from two frames ago, used for a very specific disposal format
    6778            0 : static stbi_uc *stbi__gif_load_next(stbi__context *s, stbi__gif *g, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi_uc *two_back)
    6779              : {
    6780              :    int dispose;
    6781              :    int first_frame;
    6782              :    int pi;
    6783              :    int pcount;
    6784              :    STBI_NOTUSED(req_comp);
    6785              : 
    6786              :    // on first frame, any non-written pixels get the background colour (non-transparent)
    6787            0 :    first_frame = 0;
    6788            0 :    if (g->out == 0) {
    6789            0 :       if (!stbi__gif_header(s, g, comp,0)) return 0; // stbi__g_failure_reason set by stbi__gif_header
    6790            0 :       if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(4, g->w, g->h, 0))
    6791            0 :          return stbi__errpuc("too large", "GIF image is too large");
    6792            0 :       pcount = g->w * g->h;
    6793            0 :       g->out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc(4 * pcount);
    6794            0 :       g->background = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc(4 * pcount);
    6795            0 :       g->history = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc(pcount);
    6796            0 :       if (!g->out || !g->background || !g->history)
    6797            0 :          return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
    6798              : 
    6799              :       // image is treated as "transparent" at the start - ie, nothing overwrites the current background;
    6800              :       // background colour is only used for pixels that are not rendered first frame, after that "background"
    6801              :       // color refers to the color that was there the previous frame.
    6802            0 :       memset(g->out, 0x00, 4 * pcount);
    6803            0 :       memset(g->background, 0x00, 4 * pcount); // state of the background (starts transparent)
    6804            0 :       memset(g->history, 0x00, pcount);        // pixels that were affected previous frame
    6805            0 :       first_frame = 1;
    6806              :    } else {
    6807              :       // second frame - how do we dispose of the previous one?
    6808            0 :       dispose = (g->eflags & 0x1C) >> 2;
    6809            0 :       pcount = g->w * g->h;
    6810              : 
    6811            0 :       if ((dispose == 3) && (two_back == 0)) {
    6812            0 :          dispose = 2; // if I don't have an image to revert back to, default to the old background
    6813              :       }
    6814              : 
    6815            0 :       if (dispose == 3) { // use previous graphic
    6816            0 :          for (pi = 0; pi < pcount; ++pi) {
    6817            0 :             if (g->history[pi]) {
    6818            0 :                memcpy( &g->out[pi * 4], &two_back[pi * 4], 4 );
    6819              :             }
    6820              :          }
    6821            0 :       } else if (dispose == 2) {
    6822              :          // restore what was changed last frame to background before that frame;
    6823            0 :          for (pi = 0; pi < pcount; ++pi) {
    6824            0 :             if (g->history[pi]) {
    6825            0 :                memcpy( &g->out[pi * 4], &g->background[pi * 4], 4 );
    6826              :             }
    6827              :          }
    6828              :       } else {
    6829              :          // This is a non-disposal case eithe way, so just
    6830              :          // leave the pixels as is, and they will become the new background
    6831              :          // 1: do not dispose
    6832              :          // 0:  not specified.
    6833              :       }
    6834              : 
    6835              :       // background is what out is after the undoing of the previou frame;
    6836            0 :       memcpy( g->background, g->out, 4 * g->w * g->h );
    6837              :    }
    6838              : 
    6839              :    // clear my history;
    6840            0 :    memset( g->history, 0x00, g->w * g->h );        // pixels that were affected previous frame
    6841              : 
    6842              :    for (;;) {
    6843            0 :       int tag = stbi__get8(s);
    6844            0 :       switch (tag) {
    6845            0 :          case 0x2C: /* Image Descriptor */
    6846              :          {
    6847              :             stbi__int32 x, y, w, h;
    6848              :             stbi_uc *o;
    6849              : 
    6850            0 :             x = stbi__get16le(s);
    6851            0 :             y = stbi__get16le(s);
    6852            0 :             w = stbi__get16le(s);
    6853            0 :             h = stbi__get16le(s);
    6854            0 :             if (((x + w) > (g->w)) || ((y + h) > (g->h)))
    6855            0 :                return stbi__errpuc("bad Image Descriptor", "Corrupt GIF");
    6856              : 
    6857            0 :             g->line_size = g->w * 4;
    6858            0 :             g->start_x = x * 4;
    6859            0 :             g->start_y = y * g->line_size;
    6860            0 :             g->max_x   = g->start_x + w * 4;
    6861            0 :             g->max_y   = g->start_y + h * g->line_size;
    6862            0 :             g->cur_x   = g->start_x;
    6863            0 :             g->cur_y   = g->start_y;
    6864              : 
    6865              :             // if the width of the specified rectangle is 0, that means
    6866              :             // we may not see *any* pixels or the image is malformed;
    6867              :             // to make sure this is caught, move the current y down to
    6868              :             // max_y (which is what out_gif_code checks).
    6869            0 :             if (w == 0)
    6870            0 :                g->cur_y = g->max_y;
    6871              : 
    6872            0 :             g->lflags = stbi__get8(s);
    6873              : 
    6874            0 :             if (g->lflags & 0x40) {
    6875            0 :                g->step = 8 * g->line_size; // first interlaced spacing
    6876            0 :                g->parse = 3;
    6877              :             } else {
    6878            0 :                g->step = g->line_size;
    6879            0 :                g->parse = 0;
    6880              :             }
    6881              : 
    6882            0 :             if (g->lflags & 0x80) {
    6883            0 :                stbi__gif_parse_colortable(s,g->lpal, 2 << (g->lflags & 7), g->eflags & 0x01 ? g->transparent : -1);
    6884            0 :                g->color_table = (stbi_uc *) g->lpal;
    6885            0 :             } else if (g->flags & 0x80) {
    6886            0 :                g->color_table = (stbi_uc *) g->pal;
    6887              :             } else
    6888            0 :                return stbi__errpuc("missing color table", "Corrupt GIF");
    6889              : 
    6890            0 :             o = stbi__process_gif_raster(s, g);
    6891            0 :             if (!o) return NULL;
    6892              : 
    6893              :             // if this was the first frame,
    6894            0 :             pcount = g->w * g->h;
    6895            0 :             if (first_frame && (g->bgindex > 0)) {
    6896              :                // if first frame, any pixel not drawn to gets the background color
    6897            0 :                for (pi = 0; pi < pcount; ++pi) {
    6898            0 :                   if (g->history[pi] == 0) {
    6899            0 :                      g->pal[g->bgindex][3] = 255; // just in case it was made transparent, undo that; It will be reset next frame if need be;
    6900            0 :                      memcpy( &g->out[pi * 4], &g->pal[g->bgindex], 4 );
    6901              :                   }
    6902              :                }
    6903              :             }
    6904              : 
    6905            0 :             return o;
    6906              :          }
    6907              : 
    6908            0 :          case 0x21: // Comment Extension.
    6909              :          {
    6910              :             int len;
    6911            0 :             int ext = stbi__get8(s);
    6912            0 :             if (ext == 0xF9) { // Graphic Control Extension.
    6913            0 :                len = stbi__get8(s);
    6914            0 :                if (len == 4) {
    6915            0 :                   g->eflags = stbi__get8(s);
    6916            0 :                   g->delay = 10 * stbi__get16le(s); // delay - 1/100th of a second, saving as 1/1000ths.
    6917              : 
    6918              :                   // unset old transparent
    6919            0 :                   if (g->transparent >= 0) {
    6920            0 :                      g->pal[g->transparent][3] = 255;
    6921              :                   }
    6922            0 :                   if (g->eflags & 0x01) {
    6923            0 :                      g->transparent = stbi__get8(s);
    6924            0 :                      if (g->transparent >= 0) {
    6925            0 :                         g->pal[g->transparent][3] = 0;
    6926              :                      }
    6927              :                   } else {
    6928              :                      // don't need transparent
    6929            0 :                      stbi__skip(s, 1);
    6930            0 :                      g->transparent = -1;
    6931              :                   }
    6932              :                } else {
    6933            0 :                   stbi__skip(s, len);
    6934            0 :                   break;
    6935              :                }
    6936              :             }
    6937            0 :             while ((len = stbi__get8(s)) != 0) {
    6938            0 :                stbi__skip(s, len);
    6939              :             }
    6940            0 :             break;
    6941              :          }
    6942              : 
    6943            0 :          case 0x3B: // gif stream termination code
    6944            0 :             return (stbi_uc *) s; // using '1' causes warning on some compilers
    6945              : 
    6946            0 :          default:
    6947            0 :             return stbi__errpuc("unknown code", "Corrupt GIF");
    6948              :       }
    6949            0 :    }
    6950              : }
    6951              : 
    6952            0 : static void *stbi__load_gif_main_outofmem(stbi__gif *g, stbi_uc *out, int **delays)
    6953              : {
    6954            0 :    STBI_FREE(g->out);
    6955            0 :    STBI_FREE(g->history);
    6956            0 :    STBI_FREE(g->background);
    6957              : 
    6958            0 :    if (out) STBI_FREE(out);
    6959            0 :    if (delays && *delays) STBI_FREE(*delays);
    6960            0 :    return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
    6961              : }
    6962              : 
    6963            0 : static void *stbi__load_gif_main(stbi__context *s, int **delays, int *x, int *y, int *z, int *comp, int req_comp)
    6964              : {

    7131            0 : static void stbi__hdr_convert(float *output, stbi_uc *input, int req_comp)
    7132              : {
    7133            0 :    if ( input[3] != 0 ) {
    7134              :       float f1;

    7136            0 :       f1 = (float) ldexp(1.0f, input[3] - (int)(128 + 8));

    7138            0 :          output[0] = (input[0] + input[1] + input[2]) * f1 / 3;
    7139              :       else {
    7140            0 :          output[0] = input[0] * f1;
    7141            0 :          output[1] = input[1] * f1;
    7142            0 :          output[2] = input[2] * f1;
    7143              :       }
    7144            0 :       if (req_comp == 2) output[1] = 1;
    7145            0 :       if (req_comp == 4) output[3] = 1;

    7147            0 :       switch (req_comp) {
    7148            0 :          case 4: output[3] = 1; /* fallthrough */
    7149            0 :          case 3: output[0] = output[1] = output[2] = 0;
    7150            0 :                  break;
    7151            0 :          case 2: output[1] = 1; /* fallthrough */
    7152            0 :          case 1: output[0] = 0;
    7153            0 :                  break;
    7154              :       }
    7155              :    }
    7156            0 : }

    7228            0 :       scanline = NULL;

    7441            0 :    if (stbi__at_eof(s)) {
    7442            0 :       stbi__rewind( s);
    7443            0 :       return 0;
    7444              :    }
    7445            0 :    if ( (*x) != 0 && (1 << 28) / (*x) < (*y)) {
    7446            0 :       stbi__rewind( s );
    7447            0 :       return 0;
    7448              :    }
    7449              : 
    7450            0 :    stbi__skip(s, 8);
    7451              : 
    7452              :    do {
    7453              :       stbi__pic_packet *packet;
    7454              : 
    7455            0 :       if (num_packets==sizeof(packets)/sizeof(packets[0]))
    7456            0 :          return 0;
    7457              : 
    7458            0 :       packet = &packets[num_packets++];
    7459            0 :       chained = stbi__get8(s);
    7460            0 :       packet->size    = stbi__get8(s);
    7461            0 :       packet->type    = stbi__get8(s);
    7462            0 :       packet->channel = stbi__get8(s);
    7463            0 :       act_comp |= packet->channel;
    7464              : 
    7465            0 :       if (stbi__at_eof(s)) {
    7466            0 :           stbi__rewind( s );
    7467            0 :           return 0;
    7468              :       }
    7469            0 :       if (packet->size != 8) {
    7470            0 :           stbi__rewind( s );
    7471            0 :           return 0;
    7472              :       }
    7473            0 :    } while (chained);
    7474              : 
    7475            0 :    *comp = (act_comp & 0x10 ? 4 : 3);
    7476              : 
    7477            0 :    return 1;
    7478              : }
    7479              : #endif
    7480              : 
    7481              : // *************************************************************************************************
    7482              : // Portable Gray Map and Portable Pixel Map loader
    7483              : // by Ken Miller
    7484              : //
    7485              : // PGM: http://netpbm.sourceforge.net/doc/pgm.html
    7486              : // PPM: http://netpbm.sourceforge.net/doc/ppm.html
    7487              : //
    7488              : // Known limitations:
    7489              : //    Does not support comments in the header section
    7490              : //    Does not support ASCII image data (formats P2 and P3)
    7491              : 
    7492              : #ifndef STBI_NO_PNM
    7493              :

    7500            1 :        stbi__rewind( s );
    7501            1 :        return 0;
    7502              :    }
    7503            0 :    return 1;
    7504              : }
    7505              :

    7543            0 : static int      stbi__pnm_isspace(char c)
    7544              : {
    7545            0 :    return c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\n' || c == '\v' || c == '\f' || c == '\r';

    7548            0 : static void     stbi__pnm_skip_whitespace(stbi__context *s, char *c)
    7549              : {
    7550              :    for (;;) {
    7551            0 :       while (!stbi__at_eof(s) && stbi__pnm_isspace(*c))

    7558            0 :          *c = (char) stbi__get8(s);
    7559              :    }
    7560            0 : }

    7562            0 : static int      stbi__pnm_isdigit(char c)
    7563              : {
    7564            0 :    return c >= '0' && c <= '9';
    7565              : }
    7566              : 
    7567            0 : static int      stbi__pnm_getinteger(stbi__context *s, char *c)

    7577              : 
    7578            0 :    return value;
    7579              : }

    7763              : 
    7764              : /*
    7765              :    revision history:
    7766              :       2.20  (2019-02-07) support utf8 filenames in Windows; fix warnings and platform ifdefs
    7767              :       2.19  (2018-02-11) fix warning
    7768              :       2.18  (2018-01-30) fix warnings
    7769              :       2.17  (2018-01-29) change sbti__shiftsigned to avoid clang -O2 bug
    7770              :                          1-bit BMP
    7771              :                          *_is_16_bit api
    7772              :                          avoid warnings
    7773              :       2.16  (2017-07-23) all functions have 16-bit variants;
    7774              :                          STBI_NO_STDIO works again;
    7775              :                          compilation fixes;
    7776              :                          fix rounding in unpremultiply;
    7777              :                          optimize vertical flip;
    7778              :                          disable raw_len validation;
    7779              :                          documentation fixes
    7780              :       2.15  (2017-03-18) fix png-1,2,4 bug; now all Imagenet JPGs decode;
    7781              :                          warning fixes; disable run-time SSE detection on gcc;
    7782              :                          uniform handling of optional "return" values;
    7783              :                          thread-safe initialization of zlib tables
    7784              :       2.14  (2017-03-03) remove deprecated STBI_JPEG_OLD; fixes for Imagenet JPGs
    7785              :       2.13  (2016-11-29) add 16-bit API, only supported for PNG right now
    7786              :       2.12  (2016-04-02) fix typo in 2.11 PSD fix that caused crashes
    7787              :       2.11  (2016-04-02) allocate large structures on the stack
    7788              :                          remove white matting for transparent PSD
    7789              :                          fix reported channel count for PNG & BMP
    7790              :                          re-enable SSE2 in non-gcc 64-bit
    7791              :                          support RGB-formatted JPEG
    7792              :                          read 16-bit PNGs (only as 8-bit)
    7793              :       2.10  (2016-01-22) avoid warning introduced in 2.09 by STBI_REALLOC_SIZED
    7794              :       2.09  (2016-01-16) allow comments in PNM files
    7795              :                          16-bit-per-pixel TGA (not bit-per-component)
    7796              :                          info() for TGA could break due to .hdr handling
    7797              :                          info() for BMP to shares code instead of sloppy parse
    7798              :                          can use STBI_REALLOC_SIZED if allocator doesn't support realloc
    7799              :                          code cleanup
    7800              :       2.08  (2015-09-13) fix to 2.07 cleanup, reading RGB PSD as RGBA
    7801              :       2.07  (2015-09-13) fix compiler warnings
    7802              :                          partial animated GIF support
    7803              :                          limited 16-bpc PSD support
    7804              :                          #ifdef unused functions
    7805              :                          bug with < 92 byte PIC,PNM,HDR,TGA
    7806              :       2.06  (2015-04-19) fix bug where PSD returns wrong '*comp' value
    7807              :       2.05  (2015-04-19) fix bug in progressive JPEG handling, fix warning
    7808              :       2.04  (2015-04-15) try to re-enable SIMD on MinGW 64-bit
    7809              :       2.03  (2015-04-12) extra corruption checking (mmozeiko)
    7810              :                          stbi_set_flip_vertically_on_load (nguillemot)
    7811              :                          fix NEON support; fix mingw support
    7812              :       2.02  (2015-01-19) fix incorrect assert, fix warning
    7813              :       2.01  (2015-01-17) fix various warnings; suppress SIMD on gcc 32-bit without -msse2
    7814              :       2.00b (2014-12-25) fix STBI_MALLOC in progressive JPEG
    7815              :       2.00  (2014-12-25) optimize JPG, including x86 SSE2 & NEON SIMD (ryg)
    7816              :                          progressive JPEG (stb)
    7817              :                          PGM/PPM support (Ken Miller)
    7818              :                          STBI_MALLOC,STBI_REALLOC,STBI_FREE
    7819              :                          GIF bugfix -- seemingly never worked
    7820              :                          STBI_NO_*, STBI_ONLY_*
    7821              :       1.48  (2014-12-14) fix incorrectly-named assert()
    7822              :       1.47  (2014-12-14) 1/2/4-bit PNG support, both direct and paletted (Omar Cornut & stb)
    7823              :                          optimize PNG (ryg)
    7824              :                          fix bug in interlaced PNG with user-specified channel count (stb)
    7825              :       1.46  (2014-08-26)
    7826              :               fix broken tRNS chunk (colorkey-style transparency) in non-paletted PNG
    7827              :       1.45  (2014-08-16)
    7828              :               fix MSVC-ARM internal compiler error by wrapping malloc
    7829              :       1.44  (2014-08-07)
    7830              :               various warning fixes from Ronny Chevalier
    7831              :       1.43  (2014-07-15)
    7832              :               fix MSVC-only compiler problem in code changed in 1.42
    7833              :       1.42  (2014-07-09)
    7834              :               don't define _CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS (affects user code)
    7835              :               fixes to stbi__cleanup_jpeg path
    7836              :               added STBI_ASSERT to avoid requiring assert.h
    7837              :       1.41  (2014-06-25)
    7838              :               fix search&replace from 1.36 that messed up comments/error messages
    7839              :       1.40  (2014-06-22)
    7840              :               fix gcc struct-initialization warning
    7841              :       1.39  (2014-06-15)
    7842              :               fix to TGA optimization when req_comp != number of components in TGA;
    7843              :               fix to GIF loading because BMP wasn't rewinding (whoops, no GIFs in my test suite)
    7844              :               add support for BMP version 5 (more ignored fields)
    7845              :       1.38  (2014-06-06)
    7846              :               suppress MSVC warnings on integer casts truncating values
    7847              :               fix accidental rename of 'skip' field of I/O
    7848              :       1.37  (2014-06-04)
    7849              :               remove duplicate typedef
    7850              :       1.36  (2014-06-03)
    7851              :               convert to header file single-file library
    7852              :               if de-iphone isn't set, load iphone images color-swapped instead of returning NULL
    7853              :       1.35  (2014-05-27)
    7854              :               various warnings
    7855              :               fix broken STBI_SIMD path
    7856              :               fix bug where stbi_load_from_file no longer left file pointer in correct place
    7857              :               fix broken non-easy path for 32-bit BMP (possibly never used)
    7858              :               TGA optimization by Arseny Kapoulkine
    7859              :       1.34  (unknown)
    7860              :               use STBI_NOTUSED in stbi__resample_row_generic(), fix one more leak in tga failure case
    7861              :       1.33  (2011-07-14)
    7862              :               make stbi_is_hdr work in STBI_NO_HDR (as specified), minor compiler-friendly improvements
    7863              :       1.32  (2011-07-13)
    7864              :               support for "info" function for all supported filetypes (SpartanJ)
    7865              :       1.31  (2011-06-20)
    7866              :               a few more leak fixes, bug in PNG handling (SpartanJ)
    7867              :       1.30  (2011-06-11)
    7868              :               added ability to load files via callbacks to accomidate custom input streams (Ben Wenger)
    7869              :               removed deprecated format-specific test/load functions
    7870              :               removed support for installable file formats (stbi_loader) -- would have been broken for IO callbacks anyway
    7871              :               error cases in bmp and tga give messages and don't leak (Raymond Barbiero, grisha)
    7872              :               fix inefficiency in decoding 32-bit BMP (David Woo)
    7873              :       1.29  (2010-08-16)
    7874              :               various warning fixes from Aurelien Pocheville
    7875              :       1.28  (2010-08-01)
    7876              :               fix bug in GIF palette transparency (SpartanJ)
    7877              :       1.27  (2010-08-01)
    7878              :               cast-to-stbi_uc to fix warnings
    7879              :       1.26  (2010-07-24)
    7880              :               fix bug in file buffering for PNG reported by SpartanJ
    7881              :       1.25  (2010-07-17)
    7882              :               refix trans_data warning (Won Chun)
    7883              :       1.24  (2010-07-12)
    7884              :               perf improvements reading from files on platforms with lock-heavy fgetc()
    7885              :               minor perf improvements for jpeg
    7886              :               deprecated type-specific functions so we'll get feedback if they're needed
    7887              :               attempt to fix trans_data warning (Won Chun)
    7888              :       1.23    fixed bug in iPhone support
    7889              :       1.22  (2010-07-10)
    7890              :               removed image *writing* support
    7891              :               stbi_info support from Jetro Lauha
    7892              :               GIF support from Jean-Marc Lienher
    7893              :               iPhone PNG-extensions from James Brown
    7894              :               warning-fixes from Nicolas Schulz and Janez Zemva (i.stbi__err. Janez (U+017D)emva)
    7895              :       1.21    fix use of 'stbi_uc' in header (reported by jon blow)
    7896              :       1.20    added support for Softimage PIC, by Tom Seddon
    7897              :       1.19    bug in interlaced PNG corruption check (found by ryg)
    7898              :       1.18  (2008-08-02)
    7899              :               fix a threading bug (local mutable static)
    7900              :       1.17    support interlaced PNG
    7901              :       1.16    major bugfix - stbi__convert_format converted one too many pixels
    7902              :       1.15    initialize some fields for thread safety
    7903              :       1.14    fix threadsafe conversion bug
    7904              :               header-file-only version (#define STBI_HEADER_FILE_ONLY before including)
    7905              :       1.13    threadsafe
    7906              :       1.12    const qualifiers in the API
    7907              :       1.11    Support installable IDCT, colorspace conversion routines
    7908              :       1.10    Fixes for 64-bit (don't use "unsigned long")
    7909              :               optimized upsampling by Fabian "ryg" Giesen
    7910              :       1.09    Fix format-conversion for PSD code (bad global variables!)
    7911              :       1.08    Thatcher Ulrich's PSD code integrated by Nicolas Schulz
    7912              :       1.07    attempt to fix C++ warning/errors again
    7913              :       1.06    attempt to fix C++ warning/errors again
    7914              :       1.05    fix TGA loading to return correct *comp and use good luminance calc
    7915              :       1.04    default float alpha is 1, not 255; use 'void *' for stbi_image_free
    7916              :       1.03    bugfixes to STBI_NO_STDIO, STBI_NO_HDR
    7917              :       1.02    support for (subset of) HDR files, float interface for preferred access to them
    7918              :       1.01    fix bug: possible bug in handling right-side up bmps... not sure
    7919              :               fix bug: the stbi__bmp_load() and stbi__tga_load() functions didn't work at all
    7920              :       1.00    interface to zlib that skips zlib header
    7921              :       0.99    correct handling of alpha in palette
    7922              :       0.98    TGA loader by lonesock; dynamically add loaders (untested)
    7923              :       0.97    jpeg errors on too large a file; also catch another malloc failure
    7924              :       0.96    fix detection of invalid v value - particleman@mollyrocket forum
    7925              :       0.95    during header scan, seek to markers in case of padding
    7926              :       0.94    STBI_NO_STDIO to disable stdio usage; rename all #defines the same
    7927              :       0.93    handle jpegtran output; verbose errors
    7928              :       0.92    read 4,8,16,24,32-bit BMP files of several formats
    7929              :       0.91    output 24-bit Windows 3.0 BMP files
    7930              :       0.90    fix a few more warnings; bump version number to approach 1.0
    7931              :       0.61    bugfixes due to Marc LeBlanc, Christopher Lloyd
    7932              :       0.60    fix compiling as c++
    7933              :       0.59    fix warnings: merge Dave Moore's -Wall fixes
    7934              :       0.58    fix bug: zlib uncompressed mode len/nlen was wrong endian
    7935              :       0.57    fix bug: jpg last huffman symbol before marker was >9 bits but less than 16 available
    7936              :       0.56    fix bug: zlib uncompressed mode len vs. nlen
    7937              :       0.55    fix bug: restart_interval not initialized to 0
    7938              :       0.54    allow NULL for 'int *comp'
    7939              :       0.53    fix bug in png 3->4; speedup png decoding
    7940              :       0.52    png handles req_comp=3,4 directly; minor cleanup; jpeg comments
    7941              :       0.51    obey req_comp requests, 1-component jpegs return as 1-component,
    7942              :               on 'test' only check type, not whether we support this variant
    7943              :       0.50  (2006-11-19)
    7944              :               first released version
    7945              : */
